com.jcabi.jdbc

Class SingleOutcome<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jcabi.jdbc.SingleOutcome<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Outcome<T>

    @Immutable
public final class SingleOutcome<T>
extends Object
implements Outcome<T>
    Outcome that returns first column in the first row.

    Use it when you need the first column in the first row: 

     Long id = new JdbcSession(source)
   .sql("SELECT id FROM user WHERE name = ?")
   .set("Jeff Lebowski")
   .select(new SingleOutcome<Long>(Long.class));

    Supported types are: String, Long, Boolean, Byte, Date, and Utc.

    By default, the outcome throws SQLException if no records are found in the ResultSet. You can change this behavior by using a two-arguments constructor (null will be returned if ResultSet is empty): 

     String name = new JdbcSession(source)
   .sql("SELECT name FROM user WHERE id = ?")
   .set(555)
   .select(new SingleOutcome<Long>(Long.class), true);
 if (name == null) {
   // such a record wasn't found in the database
 }
    Since:
    0.1.8
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Yegor Bugayenko (yegor@tpc2.com)
